verses.roman:
vyakta kari' bhāgavate kahe bāra bāra
kali-yuge dharma--nāma-saṅkīrtana sāra

synonyms: vyakta—evident; kari'-making; bhāgavate—in Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam; kahe—they say; bāra bāra—time and time again; kali-yuge—in the Age of Kali; dharma—the religion; nāma-saṅkīrtana—congregational chanting of the holy name; sāra—the essence.
translation: In Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam it is repeatedly and clearly said that the essence of religion in the Age of Kali is the chanting of the holy name of Kṛṣṇa.
